title: Introduction to Plant Biology
description: This course introduces students to the internal and external structure of plants. Students will learn about different parts of a plant such as roots, stems, leaves, flowers, fruits, and seeds. The course explains the functions of each part and how they help plants grow, reproduce, and survive. Students will also explore plant tissues, types of roots and stems, leaf structure, and basic concepts of photosynthesis. By the end of the course, students will understand how plants are structured and why each part is important.
